title: Badge notification inaccurate
text:
My badge notification for this app is no longer accurate. It shows I have 34 unread emails when I have none. I had other accounts connected to the app, but I have removed them or disabled them and it is still not accurate. Very frustrating. I turned off the badge. Otherwise, it’s very user friendly-much more so than the mail app for iOS.

Two days later, I received a suggestion to delete the app and reinstall. It fixed the issue. Thanks!

title: Good overall, it needs some improvement
text: While I do consider this to be one of the best available apps, I don’t think that it lives up to its full potential. Being the official google iPhone application I think there needs to be improvements made in the way that promotional or other group emails can be treated together, specifically there should be an option to delete all of promotional emails at once instead of selecting them one by one directly from the app. Additional options like archiving should also be available for an entire group of email. At least a select all option would be helpful.

title: No Update - Same Troubles
text:
It's been a week or two since I last submitted a review and the same problems remain. It won't let me access any of my hotmail accounts, email notifications are sparse (if any) despite the app being set to continuous refresh and to notify instantly, settings changes revert as soon as you save to commit them, etc.

I wasn't asking for a developer comment or anything, I just wanted to see these issues addressed or at least acknowledged as I've seen several other reviewers bring them up as well. However, being able to access my email is vital to me as a graduate student and seeing as this app is unusable now, I have no option but to delete and turn elsewhere. It was a good 7 years of service while it lasted. Adieu Google!

title: Can't Empty Trash
text: I'm going through YEARS of old emails because suddenly Gmail, Drive, and Google Photos are lumped into one big storage system and I'm low on storage. I'm tying to delete my emails and it keeps giving me error messages, including a ridiculous one when I try to empty my trash folder that says "Unable to permanently delete all items. Some items may have been deleted" ...Uh, YEAH. THAT'S WHAT I'M TRYING TO DO!!! Very frustrating, seems like Google is turning to the dark side and trying to get every penny out of us as most companies nowadays are. I loved using Gmail before the storage merge and the random ads that now pop up in your inbox (and you cant select-delete them when you go through all your emails, only way to get rid of them is to swipe-delete)

title: Ads in middle of email list?
text: Gmail has started putting ads in the middle of email lists, not just at the top. The top seemed like fair game, but this is like being spammed by the very people who are supposed to be preventing that (with their spam filter algorithm, etc) and you can’t do anything about it. There are lots of reasons, probably better reasons than this, to not use Gmail. But when you make the day-to-day experience negative it’s a strong motivator and a regular reminder. It’s as if they want to nag you into leaving. So I will be. Won’t hurt Google but maybe once people start peeling away from their core services and the initial friction to change is overcome and we can depend on them less and less.

title: Excellent app but still can be improved!
text:
Hi,
I’ve been using gmail app for a while(you know this of course) and I like it very much. It would be more useful and practical if the search bar has more selection options like date/times ranges instead of just a text search just like on the desktop version or browser version gmail does so that a user can select a specific date emails or a range of dates emails. I wish to see this option sometime in the future update/version of this app. Thanks!

title: No Delete All
text: My only problem with this app, and the reason I don’t use it as my default email app, is the fact that I cannot simply select an option to delete all messages in a folder. I have to literally touch every single email if I wanted to delete them all and that’s very time consuming. So instead I end up with thousands of emails since I don’t have the time to simply check a box to select all emails and then delete them. Please implement a feature that allows me to select all emails in a folder and then delete them all at once. Otherwise I’m a big fan of Gmail. I just wish I could delete all emails at once.

title: Glitchy Notifications and No Dark Mode!
text: Disappointed that the native google app for their email service is so limited. I still don’t have dark mode which is apparently only available for some people. Often when I clear all my unread emails I still have badge notifications that there are unread emails. There doesn’t seem to be a way to clear the notification. I expect more from google especially when they closed down Inbox which was a far superior email app to the Gmail app.

title: Has my gmail account been hacked? 2018
text: November 2018 I received a message telling me I had to pay $$ in order to keep my Gmail account active... I ignored the message. Soon it told me I would no long receive inbox messages and I could no longer send, forward or transfer anything from MY gmail account .... AGAIN, I ignored the message... figuring it was just Spam...  SURE ENOUGH.. November 2018 was the last of any incoming mail... even the junk mail ceased.... So NOW, June 2020, when I need to access info from my account... I get a blank screen... I CAN’T  ACCESS the existing emails that have been their since 2009. I would not have known who to contact about this anyway... One would think Google would gave better technology to tract these hackers from sabotaging their users accounts. So I give gmail one start for that.

title: Spam and junk mail
text: If your going to charge for storage stop with all the junk mail. I’m pretty sure everyone would have a lot of storage if it wasn’t 90% junk mail. Make a easy way to delete the emails. No I one will logically have 10,000+ emails. That’s because the things you have to go through to delete emails is insane. I just can’t see me paying for emails that I never signed up for. Come on Google make it make since. You can’t charge us for junk emails. Deliver it to us and say pay for these.

title: Love gmail but app crashes a lot when playing WAV files😥
text:
I love gmail and it is a great platform. I use it at work and have been having many issues for about a month since the last update. Our PBX attaches voicemails to an email and sends the voicemail as a WAV file. Every time I attempt to play a voicemail from the app it completely crashes. I work in the IT office so I am decently confident it is not user error. The app crashes when I play the message from the message list screen as well as after opening the message. 
I have an iPhone 11, but had this problem when I still had the iPhone 10. Apparently buying a new phone didn’t fix the problem. Please fix! After another month or so of not answering voicemail my boss will get upset.

title: Too many notifications from Trash
text: Generally I love this app! It works well, looks good, and allows you to control a lot of what you see and don’t see. But I rated it 3 stars due to an issue I’ve had for the last couple of months. Out of the blue, I started getting notifications for mail in my trash. I’ve tried everything to stop it from happening- double checked my notifications settings, deleted and reinstalled the app, signing in and out- but nothing seems to fix it! I keep getting notifications for trashed emails. It’s becoming a real issue as I’ve had to turn off notifications all together due to the amount of notifications I was getting from my trash.

title: Lousy design, lost functionality. Direct result of a monopoly
text:
Update: The design is better, but now the app asks me if I want Chrome instead of Safari EVERY SINGLE TIME. Yes, even when the “ask me every time” switch is off. VERY annoying. Get it through your heads, I don’t need another browser on my iPhone. 

Original review: The design is loud and confusing, but I probably would have gotten used to it. However, basic cut-copy-paste between Gmail and, say, IPhones Notes DOESN'T WORK. Could it be because Google also sells a phone?  Also the image attachment puts the image right into the message... so unprofessional and 1990s. But since Google convinced everyone including me that their mail is most secure (doubtful), there's no motivation to go back to the better or offer these as preferences. I'm disappointed but not surprised

title: Merging various gmail accounts
text: How do I merge different gmail accounts created so that I can receive all my important emails?  I move around a lot and do have a tendency to forget my passwords.  That is the main reason why I have so many accounts.  I do not want to write my passwords on paper because of theft.  That person has access to my sensitive information to take my identity, mess with my credit, etc.  What can your company do to assist me in being able to manage my sensitive information, etc?  Please advise.  Kim 🇨🇰

title: Glitchy?
text: I am so surprised to write a poor review, but with all of the automatic saving Google tools are capable of, I find it shocking that the app shows old drafts of emails being sent even after those drafts are edited and sent - it is confusing and has made me feel like I’ve sent the wrong version of an email so often. When I go to check my sent folder (in a panic) on my computer, I can see that the most updated draft was indeed sent, but the sent folder in the app should reflect that as well. The app could be an amazing tool, but not if I have to constantly run to my computer to double check on whether or not the most recently revised version of an email is being sent.

title: Unable to access my gmail account
text: I have had this gmail for years and have had no issues. Just recently about 2 days ago I got automatically signed out which states that there might be suspicious activity or malware on my iPhone. I haven’t downloaded any new apps prior to this incident and when trying to log in through the app it keeps telling me to verify myself which I have multiple times and gives me an error 404 which states error that’s all we know. I tried looking in the forums which are no help so I need to be able to recover my gmail account on my phone since I use it for work. Weird part is that I am able to access the gmail through a desktop or through safari but no able to sign on through the app.

title: GETTING ERRORS
text: Every time I’m on my PlayStation 4 I try to reset my password and when I go to gmail it loads error or (!) and I don’t know why .., I thought you guys would have Fixed it so I waited months to see if it would change but it never changes so it’s still the same way and I’m reaching out to you guys to see if we can fix the issue cause I love the app but it’s unusable if I can’t get any emails that get sent to my gmail account it I try to load it and it loads ( ! ) I don’t see anything so guys at gmail can you please take a look at this and see if we can get this fixed!! 🤦🏽‍♂️

title: Worst email app
text: I’ve used gmail for many years. Now they charge for storage. Worse than charging for storage there is no select all for deletion button making it very tedious & time consuming to select each email one by one and not even easy for junk mail folder. Also I can’t un-sync Google photos and every picture I take, takes up space. My problem would be solved if I could my iPhone photos to not go to google photos and if I could delete emails in bulk. I’m about to abandon my account because I can’t get new emails and after spending hours deleting crap emails and trying to get Google photos to NOT store my iPhone photos I still can’t receive new emails. And I already pay Apple for iCloud so won’t be paying for crap google.

title: It Gets Me By
text:
When I’m in a pinch and have to travel super light, I like having the option of packing my iPad instead of my laptop. 

Since I often have to work on the go, I need to be able to access my company email which is through GSuite. 

It’s nice that I have access to all of my work emails, historical and present through the app but it does have a couple limitations that are really frustrating. 

First, it doesn’t consistently carry over your custom signature. Mine is standard for our company with my illustrated avatar, contact info, etc. and it only carries over on SOME emails sent through the app. “Some” is a very generous way to describe it since it’s only happened once in the last year of using the application. 

Second, you can’t embed a hyperlink in a word. This makes for unacceptably unprofessional looking emails to clients. I know this potentially a limitation of relying on iOS, but Outlook has successfully allowed that feature in their application so it’s absolutely doable and unacceptable to not for a company as big and supposedly as innovative as Google.

title: Inexcusable bugs and performance issues on iOS
text:
This is one of Google’s flagship products. Google is one of the very most valuable global companies. I think it’s inexcusable, therefore, that the app randomly crashes, that typing freezes up as if multiple keys are pressed simultaneously when none are, that to forward an email you have to tap into a secondary options menu, and most of all, that the app cannot handle basic copy/paste, or recognizing links and phone numbers. 

Among other minor issues, these extraordinarily interruptive ones make this, to me, an inexcusably flawed product. That these issues have persisted for the 7+ years I’ve been using the app is even more inexcusable. 

My company switches to Outlook this year. Good riddance, Gmail.

title: Much worse than Yahoo Mail app
text:
[Update as of March 2019: I am happy to report that the developer fixed the annoying erratic behavior of the cursor when switching between dictation Mode and typing mode. A real improvement, thank you!]
Crashes while email writing at least twice a week. 
Less screening and search options than the Yahoo mail app.
 Also, I dictate most of my emails. Every single time I stop dictating and go back to keyboard mode in order to correct the email, the cursor keeps dropping back to the end of the text instead of staying where I am trying to correct a typo. Very annoying. I have to use Gmail for work but I hate it. Not even that good under Windows

title: Keep it simple to use!
text: I just tried to forward an email and couldn’t see a forward button. Used to be an arrow. Instead I see archive and snooze and all these other stupid buttons. I use gmail for personal use. Used to love it but they keep changing it to where you have to learn symbols instead of the simple reply/forward text. I can learn symbols just don’t like them. Just keeps getting too complicated like outlook which I hate. Gmail is great for if you want to save emails and find them later. But they are trying to make it fancy - it’s email!! Write, send, attach. We have too many other apps to deal with. Keep email interface simple! App shows all the inboxes at same time whereas in computer I was able to see primary email.

title: Losing my interest fast!
text: I have been a user of the gmail inbox for quite some time now. My concern of reference is about members who of lack the ability to check their emails often. When users log on their gmail by using their mobile devices and want to delete past emails, they’re only allowed to click each email one by one. This makes the task of deleting old emails tedious and time consuming. There should be a "delete all" tab and function of deleting every email within that category or specify the type to be deleted. If the deletion is made in error or by mistake, users should have 10 consecutive days to fix thus said error of deletion.

title: I love gmail...
text: ... but it doesn't make sense that I have to manually click on All Mail every time I open the app. Shouldn't 'All' of my mail really be the first thing I see when I log in to my email? Instead, Gmail just kinda decides for itself what it thinks I need to see, which is a choice that is almost always wrong and doesn't display what I log in to look at. I've yet to have the built-in feature that decides what category it wants to show ever work out in my favor. Kinda wondering why at this point every other user hasn't been annoyed enough for the Gmail team to change it. Other than that, it's still a useful app and a quality team of people engineering it.

title: Google Review
text:
Good afternoon,
 I am ver pleased with my google gmail service. It has always been very dependable and I’m thankful for that. I have to say there is only one exception….when solicitors repeatedly email me and I put them on my do not want to receive any more list. I still receive emails from them. Now I do not know if that’s through Gmail or through the solicitors but I would like it to be resolved. Other than that google overall has been great to me, whether it be Gmail, or actual google Chrome! I’m very pleased.

Thanks,
Rhoda F.

title: Best Nail fill and Pedicure ever!
text: l received a beautiful new color with a fill today in 30 minutes!  it was done with high quality and precision like i’d never received before. Cici is  truly a great nail professional.  then my pedicure was also amazing. the gentleman (Kevin)was very gentle! and carefully worked on the cuticle of each nail with intent to clean them up.  i’ve never left a review before but i just had to acknowledge this salon and their dedicated staff. After 6 months of disappointing experiences in front royal  I finally found “my place” for nails in my new location!

title: Suggestions
text: This a great app. I starred using it because I have multiple accounts for my work and personal use. The only thing I would love to see is the theme settings for different accounts. I keep different themes for my different accounts which helps me identify the account without looking at the account id and I tend to make less mistakes because of the theme option. This feature is not available in the gmail app right now but it would be great to get this feature in it so that I can identify my account by just looking at the background.

title: iOS/iPadOS 15.x
text:
UPDATE (two years later): nothing's changed
---
Four stars because of a clean interface coupled with “snooze” and “scheduled send,” two essential functions for business and personal use. There are many problems, however. In short, users should be able to do everything from within this app that they can do via Safari on iOS. Examples include: Proper signature support from within app; Rich text, lists, indent; More granular control (eg, delete a particular message from a thread, resend a particular email, etc.); Allow users to view old emails while composing a new message (see iOS Mail for a good example of this); Etc.

title: Please give us “mark unread”
text: I think this app works great to read email when I’m not at my computer, but the full version of Gmail that I access thru a browser allows me to mark an email as unread. I use this often to know which email I need to go back to and reply when I’ve got the full keyboard etc at my fingertips. I know I’m not alone by far with wishing the app would allow us to mark email as unread so we know to get back to it later. The current only workaround I know is to forward the email to myself, but then it’s always from me, not the original sender.

title: Smooth Interface
text: I enjoy this. Not sure what it is anyone would complain over or praise, as I can’t find anything dislikable about it. If the Google company reads this and is open to suggestions, I have one. A day and night scheme. By day, the layout design reflects that’s if day or what the user would apply as day, by night, same concept. I realize such effects could zap battery power but o think that should be up to the user if anything. Besides it would only happen within the app when it’s active, in theory at least. Great app thanks so much for making it.

title: Maybe ok if I wasn’t comparing it to Inbox
text: I hate this app so much. I used inbox until the bitter end, but have spent the last couple weeks trying to like the Gmail app. Every day I discover something new that annoys me. Like today I wanted to look up information about an upcoming trip. Inbox would have had it all in one place right where I needed it. I wish I could delete the entire promotions in box with a single click. I love that in the inbox I could pin the random promotions that I wanted to save and easily delete the rest. I like a clean inbox and HATE the ads (but accept that they may be necessary for a free product). Google had two products - one was clearly superior and they got rid of it. I’m looking for an alternative!

title: Constantly changing UI by a team that doesn't listen to customers
text: I've used Google and Gmail on the web but never felt their mobile apps really understood the mobile experience. Inbox was different and was a great app! Google shutdown Inbox and forced it’s users, with no warning to use Gmail. The UI in Gmail tries to be the same as the UI for the web in 1 / 20th the space. It doesn't do it well. It's confusing and difficult to use to be productive. If you have an email full of junk that you never check, then the Gmail app is for you. If you use email to communicate with friends or family, or for work use a better app and don't waste your time. I deleted Gmail and Inbox today and switched to Spark. And I won't be coming back. But don't tell my sister as she used to work there.

title: Swiping to archive? Why not swipe to delete
text: I don’t understand why swiping right archives an email why can’t it just delete the email instead? There is no easy or intuitive way to delete emails on this app for me, and it’s always a hassle trying to delete tons of emails at once. At least make the swipe function customizable for users who don’t care about archiving. Also, on the new update for the web chrome browser, the design is terrible for multiple open tabs because there is no clear separation between each tab so you can’t tell which tab you’re even on. Maybe it’s your way of discouraging users to have tons of tabs open, but there must be a better way for that, and it’s just user preference.

title: I have a single problem
text: I was having issues with apples default mail app as I accidentally logged out and it would not let me log back in. So I got this as an alternative. It is  early perfect but there is one feature it needs so much that apple mail had. The ability to mark all emails as read. I get a bunch of emails because I follow a lot of youtubers and other things . And I don’t mind getting them, but I would love the ability to make them all as read instead of reading them one by one or hand selecting them all and marking them as read. If this could be attended to it would be much appreciated.

title: Love gmail
text: I have been using Gmail for over a decade and I love it. It would be nice if the Google calendar was an option with the app as well like how Outlook is. I hate downloading all of these apps and with Outlook all I have to do is click on the Calendar at the bottom of the app and if I need to switch back to my email just click on the email at the bottom, so that would be nice for Google to add that on as an option probably, but overall been using Google for years and even using it for my businesses.

title: Email All Star
text: I’ve used gmail for years. Tested and used other mail systems as well and gmail has always been a favorite. It offers and delivers helpful features, updated looks (if you want to!) and a clean interface. I agree that if it ain’t broke don’t fix it…but gmail tows the fine line of: why not add what you need to what already works…yeah, why not? Love it. Would highly recommend. Especially for healthcare since they have the ability to be made HIPAA compliant. To the team at Google- thanks for the excellence:)

title: Please divide emails
text: I have multiple email accounts with google. Like one for personal, one for e-billing, and my business. I have had no problems with them at all except I would like to see more separation or organization and dividing to the them. They get consolidated all enter woven amongst all email accounts so I will have to log into each of my accounts and delete the same thing over across all my emails. Keynote is I always check my emails with my phone, but also rarely check it with my laptop. If it is a operators error please let me know how to correct it.

title: Two factor sign in
text: I had to load the gmail app because the two factor sign in lock screen notifications for the Google app on the latest iOS 12 stopped showing locked screen notifications.  While the 2FA lock screen notifications work with this app, there is no way to show just sign in notifications and not all email.  I get way too much email so I need to split the notifications.  Also bulk management of marking and archiving groups of emails like dev notices or google alerts have to be done one by one which doesn’t work for tens or hundreds.  Doing text searches inside an email to find something when you already are on the message you want but need to find and copy something is difficult.

title: Some great qualities and some negative
text: I love how versatile Google is in general. They really have cornered every market digitally and I enjoy their mail app to a certain point. I hate the interface, I hate that you’re limited to what settings you can control from the app. Versus needing detailed settings you’ll have to go to the online site. It’s quick and responsive in my opinion. Always get my mail quickly. But I hate all the add on mailboxes. The sub folders are irritating. And I think just purely speaking of aesthetic and visual design, the look could use some modernization. It’s look reminds me of yahoo circa 1996. Both the online full email suite and the app.... could be designed wayyyy more savvy imho.

title: Awesome but not perfect
text: All the changes and updates and fixes have made this an awesome email app again! Love the ability to swipe to archive or delete emails. In the settings you can change it from archive to delete. I wish on the email list where you swipe either to archive or delete I wish they would give you two options: swipe one way to archive or delete and swipe the other way to send to junk or move it to a folder. Swiping both left or right to only archive or delete is pretty lame! Give us choices! Minus one star for not having that ability, if it comes it will be 5 stars!

title: Features wanted
text:
I use my main Gmail account via the iPhone’s mail app instead of Google’s app because of missing conveniences. I would like to be able to mark an email as “unread” after opening. This highlights it in the list. 
The most important feature I want is to “unthread” and separate emails (into single emails) that are part of a chain of replies. This is very important if you are selling things on Craigslist or eBay. I know it’s possible to do this on a computer w/ Gmail but not via the Google app for phone. 
I would also like to edit the subject line of an email sent to me to make it easier to find in the future (most people write crappy subject lines).

title: Very inconsistent.
text:
In general I like the app. It’s very easy to use, very user-friendly, and pretty easy to get done what you need to do from an email perspective. I am able to file emails, create filters, star emails that I need to deal with later, and pretty functionally solid.

My big problem with this app is that whether I’m using the iPhone or the iPad or the PC to look at my Gmail quite often they are not the same. I may delete an email on the PC and it shows up for another week still in my iPhone or my iPad app. And recently I’ve noticed that emails that I’ve either filed or deleted on my PC or iPhone are still showing up in my iPad weeks later. This seems like pretty basic functionally that Google should be able to figure out, and make it work consistently. 

I’ve followed all of the recommendations about uninstalling and reinstalling the apps on the iPhone and the iPad, but nothing seems to fix this problem on a consistent basis. 

Honestly, I should give them one star because this is basic functionality that they can’t get right.

title: Prefer over the inbox app
text: I always used the Gmail app until about a year ago when I was told about inbox for Gmail and how much better it was. I was enjoying the app until I started noticing the notification saying I have two emails would never go away. Even though I had logged into a computer to ensure I had 0 unread emails. An update came through and that still did not fix the issue. I decided after two months to go back to the Gmail app, and I have been satisfied ever since. I don't think I'll go back to the inbox app.

title: Good
text: This app is overall pretty good, I use it a ton and sends fast. Gives you a chance to undo send and the font and email customization is great. Buuuut, it doesn’t block spam, and I wish there was a feature that said when someone not in your contacts emails you. Aside from newsletters and stuff from business’s. And I wish there was a “Clear All New Emails” button because I spend hours deleting useless emails from AllRecipes and Pinterest and stuff like that 🙄. That’s why I gave it four stars. Overall pretty good, with some suggestions. Thank you for your time.

title: Update broke unread messages number
text: I just recently updated from a very old version which still has the old branding (red M). I have an iPhone. When I clicked on my profile circle at the top right, it would show me all the other GMail accounts I was logged in to and a number next to each profile circle showing the number of unread emails in each account. It was very handy so I could see if I had unread email in any of my accounts. Those numbers have all gone away with this update and now I have to go to each account individually to check my mail. Consider bringing this feature back.

title: Love Gmail, but this app needs improving
text:
In general, Gmail is great. But this app is becoming more and more frustrating to use. Can’t tab between fields when composing an email? Copy and paste text from Notes and then the text simply doesn’t send in the email? Integrated web browser so you can’t reference your email after clicking a link in the email? No bulleted or numbered lists? Or really anything but the most simple formatting? These are all extremely basic things that any email app developer should know are important to include by now. Essentially the usability in general is not even close to on point and needs a refresh. 

We can do better guys. I know it.

title: Too invasive and annoying
text:
The Promotional tab now has advertisements that look like emails and if you delete them the app requests to know exactly why you removed it. Then under that there are preferred promotional emails that rise to top of the email list, which I assume are companies that pay Google to do this. 

When clicking a link within any email the app asks if you want to switch to (I.e. download and install) Chrome. Even if you select Do Not Ask Me Again, it’ll keep asking. And if you accidentally select Chrome it’ll go to the App Store and this delay you opening the link in Safari. Again, really annoying for them to cram Chrome down our throats. 

Lastly, now I’m seeing orange text asking me if I want to reply to messages that were received 5+ days ago. Even if I don’t want to reply there isn’t a way to dismiss the message so it’s always there until I delete it. 

Overall I’m just tired of Google telling me what’s best for me and sacrificing simplicity for their advertisements. I get it: they need to make money but there are better ways to do that. 

Uninstalled the app and likely won’t go back to it. I’m using the native iOS Mail app now.

title: When will Gmail mobile app allow use of Templates
text: When will the Gmail mobile app allow use of Templates. Currently that feature only works on the web browser but not the mobile app, yet most people use the mobile app probably 75% of the time or higher.  I know there’s a long workaround by using Drafts and copying and pasting etc but why wouldn’t the mobile mail app just give us the option to use templates we have already created while on the web browser, or give us the option to create new templates in the mobile mail app? Is this feature in the works for mobile mail app?

title: Worthless
text:
What use is an email app that does not send you notifications? Today I realized that for about the third time in a couple weeks that I had not received any Gmail notifications in a couple of days. Open the app - boom, 7 very important emails I never received notifications for. No badge on the app, nothing. I had previously though it was a fluke because it worked OK for the past few months I’ve had it, but it’s no longer working.

I hate this app and would just use iOS Mail if I could. Besides the notifications, the aesthetic is just bad and the gestures and controls are not intuitive to me. I only use it because my university email account apparently requires it. Maybe I can find a work around for that.

title: Issues with notifications is driving me insane
text: I like to keep my personal and work life separate so I have my personal email go through Apple’s mail app and I have the gmail app downloaded for my work email. The app stopped sending me push notifications for new emails. No banners, no badges, nothing. But I still get them for chats. Just not emails. Other times, the app has a badge saying I have notifications but then I open the app and there is nothing new. Right now I allegedly have 5 notifications from the gmail app but there are no unread emails or chats. My phone is up to date and I have uninstalled and reinstalled the app 3 times and it fixes the problem temporarily but within a week or so, it’s back to doing the same thing.
